taxonomicnotes: Carinotetraodon travancoricus was originally described as Tetraodon (Monotretus) travancoricus from Pamba river, Kerala, India (Hora and Nair 1941).
rationale: Carinotetraodon travancoricus is considered to be Vulnerable resulting from habitat modifications caused by deforestation and conversion of lands in agricultural areas, increasing urbanization, and overharvesting for the pet trade. It is believed that 30-40% of the population will have declined over a ten year period (five years in the past and five years in the future).
evaluator: Arunachalam, M., Madhusoodana Kurup, B., Basheer, V.S., Abraham, R., Krishna , K.K., Raghavan, R. & Cox, N.A.
